newsitem.title: USA: US FTC staff agree with FCC rule on LMDS licenses.
newsitem.headline: US FTC staff agree with FCC rule on LMDS licenses.

text.p: Staff of the Federal Trade Commission said Friday they supported efforts by the Federal Communications Commission to establish a cross-ownership rule to restrict local phone or cable companies from acquiring licenses for local microwave service.
Local multipoint distribution service (LMDS) can be used for two-way voice, video and data transmission, potentially in competition with local phone or cable companies.
In a statement, FTC staff said local phone or cable companies that acquired a LMDS license for their same area could forestall a third party or could raise the price of both services.
